intro: Aethusa segetalis, commonly known as the field beanweed, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in disturbed soils and agricultural fields. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its seeds are small and dry, often dispersed by wind. Aethusa segetalis is characterized by its distinctive foliage and its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor environments.
